metadata.name: Gerhard #439
metadata.description:
Gerhard is a collaboration of Richard Nadler and Leander Herzog on fxhash. A generative animation based on multiple layers of color and data, mixed, moved and painted over in realtime. Some fragments stick to the canvas while others get discarded to leave the existing layers visible, allowing a complex surface to emerge and build up over time. 
Richard Nadler created the textures to control composition and color. Leander Herzog created the code for the interplay between the layers, motion and interactions. Both artists use different tools and are not aware of the details of each others process, meeting through the interface of pixels. This collaboration is enabled by twitter and fxhash, as the generative art community continues to explore abstraction in summer 2022 ‚Äì while extreme temperatures, wildfires, ongoing conflicts and volatile markets continue to escalate. 

- Click to start a new layer of motion and color. 
- Doubleclick to enter fullscreen mode. 
- Press ‚Äús‚Äù to save the current canvas. 
- Append ?dpr=4 to the url to increase the resolution.

https://leanderherzog.ch/2022/gerhard/

metadata.name: Sand Shapes #83
metadata.description:
An experiment in line texture by Nate Donato, this piece features lines composed of a sand-like particle texture.  Bounds around line generation properties were set loosely, resulting in many possible line characters with unique weights, wobbles, and more.  Lines are generated in individual layered segments one by one, resulting in a pleasing animation of gradual composition as they compose one of twelve possible shapes, in one of eight possible color schemes.  

Each "line" is made up of thousands of points, and so rendering the live view of this piece may be computer intensive.  As an added bonus a small amount of proprietary line data is emitted to the development console, allowing the minted collection to serve as a palette of potential line qualities for the artist to use in future works.  Any owners of pieces used in this way by the artist on future projects will be granted a share of said future project's royalties.

In active live view, press [1] to view medium res, [2] to view high res, and [0] to return to original viewport width view.

Written in vanilla JavaScript without the use of external libraries.

metadata.name: Kinetic Bug #171
metadata.description:
Best viewed on a decent GPU,  because physics simulations are performance intensive. Otherwise you might encounter a bug...

In a world of digital data, a new life is born. We are not alone...
Explore how kinetic bugs make their way through the world. What will their destiny be?
It's curious that we can sympathize to a predefined creature living it's predestined life in the digital world. Coding in the computer abyss reveals interesting worlds.

Keyboard
[ space ] - jump
[ click ] - increase velocity briefly
[ r ] - restart simulation
[ s ] - save image
[ f ] - full screen

Mobile
[ two finger tap ] - jump
[ tap ] - increase velocity briefly

Created with Three.js + rapier.js
Copyright (c) July 2022 Shaderism

metadata.name: [glitchscape] #82
metadata.description:
this glitchy landscape is a place for you to get lost in as you wander keep your hands in your pockets keep your soul close don't stare at the sun it is oh so hungry.  

enjoy the evening sky.

---

this piece progressively renders until the final result is in place. please be patient as it chunks along depositing pixels to the screen.

palettes via chromotome.

---

press 's' to save high-res (3000x3000) image at any step of the way.

metadata.name: Malaphors #86
metadata.description:
Malaphor: Noun: An error in which two similar figures of speech are merged, producing an often nonsensical result.
Life is full of people giving advice and although we should always listen, we should take care to only follow good advice. 
What I love (and hate!) about proverbs is that they are nearly always used just after something bad has happened and are therefore often of little or no help at the time!

Each work features 5 Malaphors (mixed up proverbs) each in a color from one of 15 palettes.
There are 5 background colors: 
Black       - 80% chance 
Dark Red    - 5% chance 
Dark Green  - 5% chance
Dark Blue   - 5% chance
Dark Gray   - 5% chance

Additional variety is possible for amount of text and fluctuation amount.

Key strokes are: 

"S" - Save the image
"1" or "Spacebar" - Make the animation start if not already looping
"2" - Move the animation on a frame
"3" - Stop the animation
"4" - Randomise the text colors (must be looping or can press "2" to move to next frame"

Made by @p1x3lboy in p5.js 
August 2022

metadata.name: 10SCII #325
metadata.description:
10SCII is my take on the famous 10 PRINT program.

10 PRINT CHR$(205.5+RND(1)); : GOTO 10 is a single line program that produces a simple but visually appealing set of forward and backward slashes.

This project riffs on the original idea by removing the vertical space between lines and widening the horizontal gap. This changes the produced pieces from a maze of slashes into a series of towers. This is then rendered and animated as ASCII.

Visit https://10print.org/ to learn more about the original program that inspired this piece.

metadata.name: Diamond Fractal Fire #89
metadata.description:
Diamond Fractal Fire interposes recursively generated poetry with similarly recursive fractal imagery. Each text (unique for each mint, but always 20 sentences in length) is generated by a custom context-free grammar algorithm, fed with lists of words selected by the creator. The fractal pattern in each edition is a variation on a Koch snowflake fractal, one of the earliest fractals described by mathematicians. These fractals grow over time at varying rates, and pulse with varying color ranges using Perlin noise, eventually filling the screen.


Push `h` to save high resolution PNG and JPG images of the complete fractal pattern (takes a moment to process)
Push `s` to save PNG and JPG images of the current browser view (with current browser window dimensions and resolution)
Push `v` to begin recording canvas as a video (with current browser window dimensions), then push `v` again to save the video
Push `f` to toggle fullscreen mode
Push `p` to toggle zoom pause
Push `r` to toggle zoom reverse
Push `c` to toggle color shift pause
Push `l` to toggle low resolution mode (improves framerate)


The animation is somewhat computationally expensive, and so it runs best on contemporary laptop and desktop computers. Mobile devices and older computers may experience low frame rates. Captured video quality may vary depending on compute and browser limitations. The animation is responsive (it will adapt to any screen or window size), and resizing your browser window also will restart the animation.

Color floors and variances represent ranges for Hue using a Hue/Saturation/Brightness (HSB) color model. Velocities represent (subtle) zoom speed differences. Noise increment and start values affect the rate and variation of color shifts.

In addition to the author's code, Diamond Fractal Fire relies on the p5.js library.

attributes.name: Text
attributes.value: Because this death nonetheless decontextualizes that extrasensory cinder. Their semiotic fractal still views that context that moves again. Meanwhile, the ruin through that long cinder reasons. Likewise, the lo-fi depth ceases. Likewise, that electricity with your electricity that moves instead nearly accepts my digital sadness. Because my tableau of that corpus blazes today. Any corpus that reasons evolves about the tableau. Likewise, that cinder devolves for their crash of that growth. And that realm over their person to your relative decay endures. Their trajectory forever salvages any tableau that recovers. And so, that tableau at that rule that reasons afterward goes. Meanwhile, their plateau above that mirth devolves today. Meanwhile, your book that tries the touch that endures above their touch of your tear evolves. Likewise, the plateau yields in my volume of this hour. Meanwhile, their silence moves. Likewise, this touch that goes reinteprets your fractal. My pathway pulses. Meanwhile, that flame approaches your plateau about my flame of their delusion. Their cracked mirth whispers yesterday. Any road that moves aligns the depth.

metadata.name: Vertical World #98
metadata.description:
This artwork is a kind of my inquiry about ambiguous boundaries.
I was a child who liked to draw but always been dissatisfied with my work. Now through coding, I was able to create the "feelings" that I wanted to express. This work is not to imitate a certain landscape or painting style, but simply paint with different brushes, and cooperate with the randomness of the computer.
"I" creates horizontal order, and "computer" creates vertical disorder. My intention is to create
ambiguous visuals in a way that doesn't give specific images, but vague atmosphere.
The meaning is computer-generated and positioned through your eyes.
(It may take more time to render if you using Firefox browser.)

- Press [s] to save png image

Created by haxenfan using p5js.

metadata.name: Shattered Obelisks #21
metadata.description:
Shattered Obelisks began as a work that is dedicated to my habit of mindlessly drawing on paper when I am stressed, depressed or immersed in difficult thoughts.

Like a patient undergoing psychotherapy and piecing together the causes of unconscious fears and anxieties, I and my artwork have assembled ourselves into something shaped, found order in the chaos and separated it from the external noise.

It took 3 months of continuous, obsessive work. I have developed a huge library, designed for hand-like drawing. The functionality of this library is four times larger than what is shown in this drop.

I plan to put this library out into the public domain when I deem it complete, and hope that it will help someone express themselves through the creative process as much as it helped for me.

In case you've encountered a problem with inverted colours, try changing browser or disabling extensions. This problem only occurred once during testing on a massive amount of devices and was resolved by disabling extensions.

IMPORTANT NOTES BLOCK:

NOTE 1: This artwork should be viewed at a browser scale of 100%. Reducing the scale will increase the amount of detail, but may unpredictably affect the preservation of the location of secondary objects.

NOTE 2: This work can be printed on a plotter. Click S for saving it in .SVG.
Detailed instructions and answers to possible questions can be found in the console output of the code.

NOTE 3: This drop is the first one from the series of 3. It will be used as AL ticket in next drops of this series.

@abakshonokoleg
01.08.2022
Tech: P5.JS
License: CC BY-SA 4.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/)

attributes.value: Accepted the Void (Black to Purple to Red)

metadata.name: Magnolia Portrait #160
metadata.description:
Inspired by observation of the incessantly-rooted Pteridophyte and Magnolia, the cognominal series, ‚ÄúMagnolia‚Äù, portrays a manifestation of layers of constant streams crossing dynamically in a flow. Through years of growing in fluxed vapor, its knots and roots construct organized and rhythmic patterns within chaotic orders. From two-dimensional layouts to three-dimensional composition, ‚ÄúMagnolia‚Äù absorbs its fundamental image, and extend it even further ‚Äî creating the core of generative artwork.

Press "s" to download

metadata.name: SoulSea #46
metadata.description:
The Soul Sea

You look down and find that the ocean in your heart is a sine wave. 
The tide gently laps onto the shore.

The soul is the sea. You are the land. 
There are waves on the shore, and the waves are slices.

Gazing at the slices, you feel the coldness of the Arctic Ocean, the permafrost of the Antarctic Sea, the deep darkness of the bottomless sea.

Stay silent, hear the sound of the waves lapping at the innumerable shores far away.
Feel the soul of the digital ocean.

Interactivities:
> Key P: Pause
> Key S: Save
> Press and move mouseX: wave moves slower / faster

Che-Yu Wu

metadata.name: Solace #142
metadata.description:
Solace is an algorithm that generates artworks of sand dunes. It draws hundreds of thousands of tiny points according to a probability distribution calculated from the positions of the dunes.

The logic to divide the dunes into light and dark sides is simple, but produces some interesting chaotic behaviour. These are details that weren't hard-coded but emerge organically, such as the patterns on the spines of the dunes or the stripes around their bases.

Please note that the algorithm can take some time to run, especially when the number of dunes is high.

Created by lunarean.

metadata.name: Dragons #476
metadata.description:
A grid of many lines forming a dragon crafted on paper.
They all have their own personality... Be sure to name and take care of them.

tw: williamapan

metadata.name: TENDER Pass #779
metadata.description:
Tender is a curatorial platform and community that helps bring incredible works of generative art to discerning collectors.

Holding a TENDER Pass enables enriched benefits and experiences within the Tender ecosystem. Passholders expand their access to unique collaborations with extraordinary artists, indispensable collector tools, curatorial experiences, artwork insights, fine art prints, a thriving community, and more.

Tender is committed to stewarding the growth of generative art and amplifying the voices of artists and collectors across the entire lifecycle: from creation to collection to curation, and back again. Every Pass minted and resold directly enables Tender to continue creating the platform and experiences that serve this mission.

‚Äî‚Äî

TENDER Pass features unique artwork by punevyr. While all Passes are special, a small number of randomly generated, rarified tokens will come with boosted benefits. If you have a piece with a dark background of any kind, you likely possess one of the following:

Bonus Pass
TENDER Passes with the special Bonus trait get 1 guaranteed reserve spot on all TENDER x Collab projects

Grail Pass
TENDER Passes with the special Grail trait get 2 free mints on all TENDER x Collab projects


New Passholders may access our Discord server that‚Äôs linked from our website.
For TENDER Pass benefits and up-to-date details, please visit tender.art/pass


Artwork created with p5.js

---

TENDER x punevyr
July 2022
